title: Bug 47910: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description:
When using ajc with the parameters sourceroots <mydir and outjar <my.jar, an output file is created with a .jar extension.
However, this file is not a valid jar file because it does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file.
The ajc documentation mentions the 'outjar' parameter as a way to put output classes in a zip file, but using it to create a jar file without a MANIFEST.MF file seems incorrect.
OB: After calling ajc with sourceroots <mydir and outjar <my.jar, an output file is created with a .jar extension.
EB: After calling ajc with sourceroots <mydir and outjar <my.jar, an output file should be created with a .jar extension AND it should contain a valid MANIFEST.MF file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Run the command ajc with the parameters sourceroots <mydir and outjar <my.jar.
2. Check the output file <my.jar to verify that it has a .jar extension but does not contain a valid MANIFEST.MF file.
